alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 5:18PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Wallace and northwestern Greeley Counties in west central Kansas through 545 PM MDT... At 518 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Weskan, or 16 miles east of Cheyenne Wells, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Cheyenne County in east central Colorado, southwestern Wallace and northwestern Greeley Counties in west central Kansas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
